fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33201].
  {panel}

Currently, if a user wants to reorder pages he has to go to "Configure Space > Sort pages" and then expand the page tree up to the point where he'd like to reorder a page. This is highly interruptive, because the current page the user was looking at previously is lost and he has to do the more clicks the deeper the page hierarchy is.

I could imagine two solutions:

- remember the currently watched page and automatically expand the page tree on the "sort pages" view up to this page
- allow re-ordering and moving of pages directly in the page hierarchy side bar (preferred)
fields.summary: Make page reordering more intuitive and less interruptive
UPM - Empty success message after upgrading plugins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33195].
  {panel}

I am using task lists as part of meeting notes for assigning action items.
The assigned task then shows up in the users personal task list.
However, when they update the task and mark it as complete, only the complete checkmark is propagated to the meeting notes actions, the comments that they enter for the task does not get copied on the page where the meeting notes are captured. 

How can i see the comments for the task show up on the meeting notes page?
fields.summary: Updating Tasks from a Task List
Official Support for MS SQL Server 2014

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33191].
  {panel}

When trying to move pages + descendents to another space, you can get the following error if pages with the same title exist:
The following error(s) occurred:
A descendent page shares the same title of another page in the selected space.

But, there is no hint about which ones are duplicated... It can take a while until you figure out if there is multiple duplications...
A list a the duplicates would be very helpful...
fields.summary: Moving pages and descendents: duplicate names are not listed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33188].
  {panel}

In a Confluence page, I create a link to an anchor inside the same page, using an Advanced link:
* If I type the link text and press Enter rapidly after writing the link text, the created link is only partially correct

Steps to reproduce:
* When editing a Confluence page, click Link icon in the toolbar
* Choose Advanced link type
* In the Link field, type eg. "#ThisIsSomeLinkToAnchor" text and hit Enter rapidly after typing the last letter (r)
* The link gets created. Now open the link (Edit link) and check the link that was created
* The link that was created is "#ThisIsSomeLi", ie. half of the letters got missing

Work-around:
* Wait for a few seconds before hitting Enter when typing a link
fields.summary: Invalid link when creating an advanced link to an anchor with rapid Enter hit
Blog Post Schedule asks for title
Expand content by hovering the mouse over

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33177].
  {panel}

Hi,

We used to be able to attach Powerpoints to a page and then view them with the Powerpoint macro, but this stopped working after a recent Confluence upgrade.

I'm not sure if this relevant, but around the same time, we started running Confluence over https.

Do you have any idea what might be wrong, or what I should try?

thanks,
Mark.
fields.summary: Powerpoint Macro not working with 5.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33175].
  {panel}

It should be possible to start editing in dem middle of an article.

Currently the user has a very high interaction impact if the wants to start editing.

Requirement: User has scrolled down to the middle of an article
Steps he must do:
1. Scroll up to top of page
2. Click Edit
3. Scroll down in edit mode to the position he wants to edit (very difficult if a lot of markup is used eg. Panels, Codeblock, Layout)

Better:
1. Hover over the section he wants to edit
  - An edit button will show up (if he has the rights to edit)
2. Click on edit
  - The edit mode opens up at the position clicked before
fields.summary: Allow to start editing on header or section
provide facilities for getting a list of all changes to a space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33168].
  {panel}

With respect to the help menu which shows up on each page:
* 5.4-OD-5 passed the complete action when generating the menu
* 5.4-OD-6 included this [change|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence/commits/aad82bb] which changed how the menu was rendered
* 5.4-OD-21-017 does not pass the complete context so if you have a menu item that requires the current space or page id, its not accessible
fields.summary: [T22,5.5] Web Items in the Help Menu no long get the action context
Provide a way to manually overwrite the personal home page with the global home page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33163].
  {panel}

The current message is generic, it would be better if we can have more detailed message when created issues could not be inserted into the page.

h3. Steps to reproduce: 
# Create page with attachment macro or mention a user then save the page.
# Select the mention user name or one word on the attachment macro
# Try to create an issue with the select text. 

h3. Expected behaviour: 
The issue will be created and the warning message should should show the same when adding an inline comment for the same. 

h3. Actual behaviour:
The warning message is showing but with out any further information.
fields.summary: Improve Create JIRA Content error message when newly created issues could not be added into page

  {panel}

I used a macro called "PlantUML macro" to display the UML diagram on the Confluence page. 
I filled property "Diagram Title" and an error occurred diagram view of the "plantuml" (property "Diagram Type" is "plantuml"). 
Without filling Diagram Title diagram is displayed correctly.

Adding pictures and display resources UML diagram.

Confluence version: 5.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33156].
  {panel}

Hello,
We have an upload size limit of 5Mb for attachments.
This suits well our politic in file managment.
However, we nedd to put sometimes somes heavy video files for demo, support or new feature.
And in this case, 5Mb is not enough.
We would like to have a specific configuration page to alter the size limit of some specific attachment like mp4,avi.
Would it be possible in future release ?

When a Confluence site host about 200 users, that is not a problem to raise the size limit. But our site hosts about 9000 users. So in this cas, i cannot raise the size limit to 50Mb...
Imagine the speed overload size after some months...
fields.summary: Have Confluence the ability to select some specific file extension to get raised for upload size limit
'depluralisation' makes search poor?
Investigate implications of cache creation all the time
Looks like every time someone changes a confluence page all Jira issues get affected.

Display user info dialog whenever user names are displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33133].
  {panel}

While page restrictions can be useful in theory, we have found that in reality, giving users permissions to adjust and modify has caused massive headaches. The over-ruling in inheritance on the way down the tree as permissions are adjusted cause an admin headache, and they cause a performance it too in my testing as the checks recurse up or down the tree. Even without the performance concerns, we just don't want that mess.

We have three options at the moment:
 - allow users to do what they want and have a mess
 - only allow admins access to manage restrictions (with 2000 users, this causes a hefty overhead on the human side)
 - disable permissions site-wide and require varying ACL requests to happen at a space level

We have currently opted for the third option as this is the best out of those 3, at least for us.

An ideal fourth option though, would be if we could limit page restrictions just so they can be managed at the first level of pages within a space. This would stop the overwriting inheritance issue and the permissions. Some people may like this to happen for the first 2 levels, some deeper, so a droplist of 1-xx depth limit on this setting would give more flexibility.
fields.summary: Limit depth that page restrictions can be added at

There is a very interesting article about this online which is very useful for improving our current search function.

http://engineering.wayfair.com/improving-german-solrlucene-search-results/

When Confluence have an empty {{SpaceKey}} value in {{spaces}} table, Confluence will not be able to load "Create" dialog and it will load forever without *any stack trace logged in Confluence log*.

!create.png|thumbnail!

User can only get a definitive answer by reviewing the console tab of browser developer tools.

!console.png|thumbnail!


*How to Replicate The Issue*

# Execute this SQL query
{code:SQL}
UPDATE spaces SET spacekey ='' WHERE spaceid = <input test space id>;{code}
# Access Confluence "Cache & Statistics" menu and click "Flush All" button
# Try to create a content

*Expected Behaviour*

Confluence should be able to catch the ERROR in the logs and it should stop the create process with a proper ERROR message in the user interface level.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33049].
  {panel}

h6. Steps to create the situation
# Create a page in Space 'A'
# The new page should be named with Special Character so that the URL to access the page will be the non-pretty URL (/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=xxxxxxx)
# Put a view restriction to the new page so that only the author can see it
# Create a new user 'Sam'

h6. Situation:
'Sam' has just joined the company. He is given the link to the new page ({{<base-URL>/pages.viewpage.action?pageId=xxxxxxx}}). However, he doesn't have permission to view the page. He needs the Space Administrator's help to add him to the page's view restriction so that he can view the page. But there's no way for him to know the Space name or where the view restriction is applied (same page or parent page) in order to inform the Space Administrator.
The Space Administrator/Sam needs to contact the DBA to find out the page name, space name, and page restriction by providing the pageId.

h6. Summary:
This procedure is time-consuming and inefficient because the user needs to find DBA every time this kind of scenario is encountered. It'll be great improvement in Confluence if there's more information provided in the restricted page such as:
- Space location
- Page that prevent access to it
- Page name

These informations can be used by Confluence Administrator or Space Administrator to grant access to a restricted page without having to contact the DBA.
fields.summary: More Information from Restricted Page with Non-pretty URL in Order to Request Admin Permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33035].
  {panel}

_This was originally posted as CORE-196, but since i don't have access to edit my own submission under CORE, and it isn't indexed by search engines, i probably wasn't supposed to (be able to) submit tickets there.  This is an SDK issue, and thus spans confluence, jira, and others, but there's no SDK project that i have permission to update, so please move this ticket to the right place if necessary.  Instead of simply leaving the ticket where it was and letting Atlassian update/move it as desired, i'm re-posting here, because i'd like this issue to be indexed by search engines so that others can discover it when they have similar concerns._

I downloaded atlassian-plugin-sdk-4.2.18.tar.gz, and the permissions are all wrong. I'd have checked the .deb or .rpm versions as well, but Atlassian doesn't offer direct download links for them.

Some files have an arbitrary UID. I imagine that this is the UID of the user someone from Atlassian uses to create the files. Note UID 502 (GID 20), below.
{code}
>>> ls -l
total 16
drwxr-xr-x  7 root root 4096 Mar 24 13:14 apache-maven
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root 4096 Mar 24 13:14 bin
-rwxrwxrwx  1  502   20    3 Feb 25 16:37 installtype.txt
drwxr-xr-x 42 root root 4096 Mar 24 13:14 repository

>>> ls -l repository 
total 160
drwxrwxrwx  3 502 20 4096 Feb 25 16:37 args4j
drwxrwxrwx  5 502 20 4096 Feb 25 16:37 asm
drwxrwxrwx  3 502 20 4096 Feb 25 16:37 backport-util-concurrent
drwxrwxrwx  3 502 20 4096 Feb 25 16:37 biz
drwxrwxrwx  3 502 20 4096 Feb 25 16:37 classworlds
...
{code}

Some files and directories are group- and world-writable. This includes directories and .jar files. Very bad for installation on a multiuser system.
{code}
>>> find . -perm -022 -print |head
./apache-maven/lib
./apache-maven/lib/maven-trap-0.5.jar
./apache-maven/lib/maven-2.1.0-uber.jar
./apache-maven/boot
./apache-maven/boot/classworlds-1.1.jar
./apache-maven/bin
./apache-maven/bin/m2.conf
./apache-maven/maven-docs/NOTICE.txt
./apache-maven/maven-docs/README.txt
./apache-maven/maven-docs/LICENSE.txt

>>> find . -perm -002 -print |wc -l
2147
{code}

Files intended for execution are only executable by the owner (mode 0744). Files meant to be executed by local users should be mode 0755 (or, if they're binaries, at least mode 0711). On the other hand, files not intended for execution should not have the executable bit set (see: m2.conf, .txt files, .jar files, etc.).
{code}
>>> ls -l bin
total 288
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20  1645 Feb 25 16:37 atlas-clean
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20  3650 Feb 25 16:37 atlas-cli
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20 10228 Feb 25 16:37 atlas-clover
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20  1619 Feb 25 16:37 atlas-compile
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20  4215 Feb 25 16:37 atlas-create-bamboo-plugin
...

>>> ls -l apache-maven/bin 
total 36
-rwxrwxrwx 1 502 20  145 Mar 18  2009 m2.conf
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20 4908 Feb 25 16:37 mvn
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20 5915 Mar 18  2009 mvn.bat
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20 4743 Mar 18  2009 mvnDebug
-rwxr--r-- 1 502 20 6100 Mar 18  2009 mvnDebug.bat
{code}

The release shown above could be sanitized by running something like the following from the root of the tree:
{code}
>>> chown -R root:root .
>>> find . -type f -perm -002 -print |xargs chmod 644
>>> find . -type d -perm -002 -print |xargs chmod 755
>>> find . -type f -perm -0100 -print |xargs chmod 755
{code}

You guys should probably do something of the sort (with modifications that will work properly with your typical release cycle) before packaging the files for distribution.
fields.summary: Atlassian SDK permissions are all wrong

Conflluence is a great product; I recommend it widely.  However lack of traditional wiki markup in more recent versions is a large gap.

The push to WYSIWYG editing is understandable for the product goals stated in support, but neglects traditional users who prefer wiki markup.  Previous versions of Confluence supported both.

Currently you can share a page with Internal users or any arbitrary e-mail address with the assumption that the receiver will in some way have access to the page (either because they are a user with permission, or because the page is public).

It would be useful to have a feature that is similar in nature to Google Drive's "Anyone with the link" visibility settings on a document. This would allow a page to still appear hidden from anonymous access (through the normal friendly URLs), but would build a unique (obscure) link so you can share the page with a known set of public (anonymous) users.

Something like:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/?key=ca30863e401056a22be7244155b8a6e8

Adding users just to share one or two "semi-public" articles is costly. I can see many cases where you may not want anyone from the outside world to easily find an article (i.e. general anonymous access), but you would want to provide a direct link to a group of trusted individuals.

_Problem_
Catpcha is not enough to prevent spam. If enabled, anonymous spam comments become soon a huge problem, with hundreds of spam every week. Spammers just want to increase their websites google ranking with referrals, so they wont' stop.
Related issues CONF-13081 and CONF-31962 are not enough.
More details here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Preventing+and+Cleaning+Up+Spam

_Solution_
Anonymous comment moderation. For each comment a notification is sent by email with two buttons: Approve | Reject. If approved, the comment is posted. If not, it's just rejected.

  {panel}

When viewing a space, the Child Pages section of the sidebar will list child pages if any. However, if there are no child pages, a cue of sorts to let the user know about sibling pages would be helpful

h5.Example (taken from a real support case)

# As part of a recovery procedure, a temporary space was created.
# Recovered pages were inserted into the space - but not as children of the home page
# The space administrator was able to see all the pages being updated, but because he didn't see any child pages in the sidebar, he was not able to find the pages themselves (to move them, etc).

h5.Isn't there a "Browse and Re-order screen"?

Yes, but it's buried inside the space administration, and requires several clicks to get there:

# Click "Space Tools"
# Click "Content Tools
# Click "Reorder Pages"

h5.How to Improve
A "Show All" link next to the "Pages" tree menu (or at the very least in the vicinity), which would link to the "Browse and Reorder" screen. This link would only appear for users who have the permissions to view the space administration screen. 

h5.What is gained?
* Better adoption of spaces and hierarchies
* Less "where did my page go?" issues
* Greater space administrator awareness of the content within a space - less orphaned pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32965].
  {panel}

In the OD edition of Confluence connected to MSSQL 2012, the reorder pages screen doesn't display any of the child pages of the space.

h3.Steps to Reproduce

1. Install 5.4-OD-5 with MSSQL 2012
2. Create a space with child pages
3. Navigate to Space Admin > Content Tools > Reorder Pages
4. Screen is blank (see screenshot)
5. The following error is thrown in the logs:

{code}
2014-03-17 18:43:18,294 ERROR [http-bio-8090-exec-15] [opensymphony.xwork.util.CompoundRootAccessor] getProperty Caught an Ognl exception while getting property JSONString
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/pages/reorderpages.action?key=ds | url: /pages/children.action | userName: admin | action: children | space: 65537
ognl.OgnlException: JSONString [org.springframework.dao.TransientDataAccessResourceException: Hibernate operation: Could not execute query; SQL []; Incorrect syntax near the keyword 'is'.; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Incorrect syntax near the keyword 'is'.]
...
org.springframework.dao.TransientDataAccessResourceException: Hibernate operation: Could not execute query; SQL []; Incorrect syntax near the keyword 'is'.; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Incorrect syntax near the keyword 'is'.
{code}

Confluence is trying to execute the following query, which fails due to a syntax error in the ORDER BY clause:

{code:sql}
select page0_.CONTENTID as CONTENTID, page0_.CHILD_POSITION as CHILD_P13_, page0_.PARENTID as PARENTID, page0_.SPACEID as SPACEID, page0_.TITLE as TITLE, page0_.VERSION as VERSION, page0_.CREATOR as CREATOR, page0_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION6_, page0_.LASTMODIFIER as LASTMODI7_, page0_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD8_, page0_.VERSIONCOMMENT as VERSIONC9_, page0_.PREVVER as PREVVER, page0_.CONTENT_STATUS as CONTENT11_ from CONTENT page0_ 
where page0_.CONTENTTYPE='PAGE' and ((page0_.PARENTID is null )and(page0_.PREVVER is null )and(page0_.SPACEID=65537 )and(page0_.CONTENT_STATUS='current' )) 
order by  page0_.CHILD_POSITION is null , page0_.CHILD_POSITION , page0_.TITLE
{code}

- *Rich status updates* It should allow links, emoticons, bold, italic and underline.
- *Improve the interaction* by allowing likes and comments.
fields.summary: Improve status update functionality
It should be possible to fully disable caching
profile image could not be adapted correctly
Attachments macro request to change default sortOrder to descending, newest attachments first
Database Integrity Checker / Validator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32938].
  {panel}

When Confluence and JIRA are set within the same database in different schemas, triggering the upgrade task will detect duplicate primary keys.

The task interprets the separate tables as s single one and halts the upgrade task. 

{quote}
h5. Current
Current queries are written to directly access the system catalog rather than information_schema. Here is one query from the log along with the result it returns, pertaining to the 'label' table:
internal_tools=# SELECT NULL AS TABLE_CAT, n.nspname AS TABLE_SCHEM, c.relname AS TABLE_NAME, CASE n.nspname ~ '^pg_' OR n.nspname = 'information_schema' WHEN true THEN CASE WHEN n.nspname = 'pg_catalog' OR n.nspname = 'information_schema' THEN CASE c.relkind WHEN 'r' THEN 'SYSTEM TABLE' WHEN 'v' THEN 'SYSTEM VIEW' WHEN 'i' THEN 'SYSTEM INDEX' ELSE NULL END WHEN n.nspname = 'pg_toast' THEN CASE c.relkind WHEN 'r' THEN 'SYSTEM TOAST TABLE' WHEN 'i' THEN 'SYSTEM TOAST INDEX' ELSE NULL END ELSE CASE c.relkind WHEN 'r' THEN 'TEMPORARY TABLE' WHEN 'i' THEN 'TEMPORARY INDEX' WHEN 'S' THEN 'TEMPORARY SEQUENCE' WHEN 'v' THEN 'TEMPORARY VIEW' ELSE NULL END END WHEN false THEN CASE c.relkind WHEN 'r' THEN 'TABLE' WHEN 'i' THEN 'INDEX' WHEN 'S' THEN 'SEQUENCE' WHEN 'v' THEN 'VIEW' WHEN 'c' THEN 'TYPE' WHEN 'f' THEN 'FOREIGN TABLE' ELSE NULL END ELSE NULL END AS TABLE_TYPE, d.description AS REMARKS FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n, pg_catalog.pg_class c LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_description d ON (c.oid = d.objoid AND d.objsubid = 0) LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class dc ON (d.classoid=dc.oid AND dc.relname='pg_class') LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace dn ON (dn.oid=dc.relnamespace AND dn.nspname='pg_catalog') WHERE c.relnamespace = n.oid AND c.relname LIKE 'label' AND (false OR ( c.relkind = 'r' AND n.nspname !~ '^pg_' AND n.nspname <> 'information_schema' ) ) ORDER BY TABLE_TYPE,TABLE_SCHEM,TABLE_NAME;

table_cat | table_schem | table_name | table_type | remarks

-----------+-------------+------------+------------+---------

           | confluence  | label      | TABLE      |

           | jira        | label      | TABLE      |

(2 rows)

h5. Proposed
the query should include a {{pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)}} clause.  Here is the same query with that added, run as the app_confluence user:

internal_tools=> SELECT NULL AS TABLE_CAT, n.nspname AS TABLE_SCHEM, c.relname AS TABLE_NAME,  CASE n.nspname ~ '^pg_' OR n.nspname = 'information_schema'  WHEN true THEN CASE  WHEN n.nspname = 'pg_catalog' OR n.nspname = 'information_schema' THEN CASE c.relkind   WHEN 'r' THEN 'SYSTEM TABLE'   WHEN 'v' THEN 'SYSTEM VIEW'   WHEN 'i' THEN 'SYSTEM INDEX'   ELSE NULL   END  WHEN n.nspname = 'pg_toast' THEN CASE c.relkind   WHEN 'r' THEN 'SYSTEM TOAST TABLE'   WHEN 'i' THEN 'SYSTEM TOAST INDEX'   ELSE NULL   END  ELSE CASE c.relkind   WHEN 'r' THEN 'TEMPORARY TABLE'   WHEN 'i' THEN 'TEMPORARY INDEX'   WHEN 'S' THEN 'TEMPORARY SEQUENCE'   WHEN 'v' THEN 'TEMPORARY VIEW'   ELSE NULL   END  END  WHEN false THEN CASE c.relkind  WHEN 'r' THEN 'TABLE'  WHEN 'i' THEN 'INDEX'  WHEN 'S' THEN 'SEQUENCE'  WHEN 'v' THEN 'VIEW'  WHEN 'c' THEN 'TYPE'  WHEN 'f' THEN 'FOREIGN TABLE'  ELSE NULL  END  ELSE NULL  END  AS TABLE_TYPE, d.description AS REMARKS  FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n, pg_catalog.pg_class c  LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_description d ON (c.oid = d.objoid AND d.objsubid = 0)  LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class dc ON (d.classoid=dc.oid AND dc.relname='pg_class')  LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace dn ON (dn.oid=dc.relnamespace AND dn.nspname='pg_catalog')  WHERE c.relnamespace = n.oid  AND c.relname LIKE 'label' AND (false  OR ( c.relkind = 'r' AND n.nspname !~ '^pg_' AND n.nspname <> 'information_schema' ) ) and pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)  ORDER BY TABLE_TYPE,TABLE_SCHEM,TABLE_NAME;

table_cat | table_schem | table_name | table_type | remarks

-----------+-------------+------------+------------+---------

           | confluence  | label      | TABLE      |

(1 row)

Alternatively they could add the suggested clause to their query, which is how the psql command-line tool works.
{quote}
fields.summary: Add support for Confluence to read different schemas in a single Postgres database
